values.description:
Mainly setting up cmake project in preparation for writing plugins, taken mostly from priuscup repo. 

Note, setup.sh file will now live in `[install_prefix]/share/citysim/setup.sh`

My plan is to put code for creating rendering effects in visual plugins and their material files in this repo, keeping a better separation from main gazebo code base
values.title: Setup CMake

summary.raw:
Mainly setting up cmake project in preparation for writing plugins, taken mostly from priuscup repo. 

Note, setup.sh file will now live in `[install_prefix]/share/citysim/setup.sh`

My plan is to put code for creating rendering effects in visual plugins and their material files in this repo, keeping a better separation from main gazebo code base
summary.html:
Mainly setting up cmake project in preparation for writing plugins, taken mostly from priuscup repo.

Note, setup.sh file will now live in [install_prefix]/share/citysim/setup.sh

My plan is to put code for creating rendering effects in visual plugins and their material files in this repo, keeping a better separation from main gazebo code base

values.title: Road grid, some buildings, Prius, trees

values.description:
requires `citysim` branch in gazebo

Note, I had to update various ign-* repos' dependencies to get gazebo's citysim branch with ign-msgs1 + ign-math4 working. We probably want to create a new branch in each ign repos to track these changes.

To test, source the setup file and run rendering.world:

    source [install_prefix]/share/citysim/setup.sh
    gazebo --verbose worlds/rendering.world


shiny grey material + bloom effect:
![bloom.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/3647211616-bloom.jpg)

view with lensflare effect
![lensflare.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/2580265865-lensflare.jpg)

The level of bloom effect can be configured (to some extent)
values.title: Add bloom and lens flare plugins

values.description:
* Revive old code for rectangular trajectories
* Implement straight trajectories
* Make straight trajectories shorter for now while we figure out the spline interpolation

![ppl.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/608045997-ppl.gif)
values.title: Trajectories

* Revive old code for rectangular trajectories
* Implement straight trajectories
* Make straight trajectories shorter for now while we figure out the spline interpolation

• Revive old code for rectangular trajectories
  • Implement straight trajectories

values.description:
* Sidewalks made out of polylines with a thickness and round corners
* Thin sidewalks for the center divider on the North road
* Removed sidewalks on the South and West because they were overhanging above the terrain
* Parked cars are now fully on the street
* Opened entrances to grocery store and fast food

![city300.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/3926844354-city300.png)

![city301.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/2818630087-city301.png)

![city302.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/206068985-city302.png)

![city303.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/1476902798-city303.png)
values.title: Sidewalks

summary.raw:
* Sidewalks made out of polylines with a thickness and round corners
* Thin sidewalks for the center divider on the North road
* Removed sidewalks on the South and West because they were overhanging above the terrain
* Parked cars are now fully on the street
* Opened entrances to grocery store and fast food

![city300.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/3926844354-city300.png)

summary.html:
• Sidewalks made out of polylines with a thickness and round corners
  • Thin sidewalks for the center divider on the North road
  • Removed sidewalks on the South and West because they were overhanging above the terrain
  • Parked cars are now fully on the street
  • Opened entrances to grocery store and fast food

values.description:
Added cars only going on the East-West direction. We could add some North-South ones too, but it would be tricky to avoid collisions.

The cars start on either end of the world and go all the way to the other end, then disappear and start again.

It needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/309/static-cars-face-x-direction/diff#comment-None) Gazebo models PR.


![cars.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/2121639853-cars.gif)
values.title: Animated cars

summary.raw:
Added cars only going on the East-West direction. We could add some North-South ones too, but it would be tricky to avoid collisions.

The cars start on either end of the world and go all the way to the other end, then disappear and start again.

It needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/309/static-cars-face-x-direction/diff#comment-None) Gazebo models PR.


![cars.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/2121639853-cars.gif)
summary.html:
Added cars only going on the East-West direction. We could add some North-South ones too, but it would be tricky to avoid collisions.

The cars start on either end of the world and go all the way to the other end, then disappear and start again.

It needs this Gazebo models PR.

values.description:
I didn't bother setting keys for yellow lights, but it's just a matter of adding them to the SDF.

Also note that the stop light model names will likely change, we should change the naming scheme.

![traffic.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RLzBkE/images/3127152384-traffic.gif)
values.title: Plugin to control traffic lights from keyboard

I'll remove the built in rain effect from gazebo's citysim branch
